experience: You and Mary both know Aric Zion, Adam Goodman, and 5 others

Inspiring stories and conversation last night at Shepley Bulfinch! Organized by the AZ AIA WLG, we heard from the curated group of not only architects, but professionals of different disciplines who inspire their communities, and they shared stories of their experiences.
The speakers included:  Matthew Moore, Wanda Dalla Costa, AIA, LEED AP, Shannon Scutari, Mary McCormick, Oye Waddell from Hustle PHX.

The themes encompassed a micro-dwelling that evoked play, invention and exploration; the distinct unit and the space in between and what connects us together; to the loss of understanding of food cultivation and how to reintegrate it; the exploration of re-instituting culture and giving back to that culture; and the reduction of barriers to entrepreneurship through a community of support and means.
It connected people, identified opportunities, inspired change, and provoked action. What’s next!? Thanks to our speakers and everyone who attended.

The Material Collective, LLC is an independent sales agency representing the following manufacturers in Arizona, New Mexico, Las Vegas, NV*, and El Paso, TX**:  Andreu World, BOLON, BuzziSpace, Chelsom, Interna, Luna Textiles, Skyline Design, and Soelberg Industries.

Increased sales 30% my first year in the Arizona, New Mexico, and Las Vegas, Nevada territory while marketing the commercial textile line to the architectural and interior design (A/D) community.Secured specifications by building relationships within the commercial, healthcare, education and hospitality markets.  Partnered with local fabricators and workrooms to win specifications directly with end users.

Responsible for the development of Haworth dealerships in the Southwest region, which included  Phoenix, San Diego, Las Vegas, Albuquerque, and Tucson, by organizing sales training sessions, sales programs training, and monthly corporate-to-dealer communication updates.  Facilitated regular collaborative marketing meetings between dealer principals, dealer management staff, Haworth A/D managers, and Haworth Business Development Managers to leverage the dealer/manufacturer relationship and increase market share.Established the Haworth brand and developed relationships within the A/D community of Phoenix, while growing the number of Haworth specifications developed through A/D firms.

Presented product solutions, product processes, and installation methods to members of the A/D and flooring contractor community while increasing brand visibility in the marketplace through participating in and hosting special events, continuing education presentations and networking opportunites.

Top salesperson in the New Business Development sales team for a leading Steelcase and HON dealership utilizing company services and resources to provide mid-market corporate customers with a turnkey office interiors solution. Increased sales through daily phone prospecting, solution-sales techniques, and weekly networking opportunities.

NEWH is the premier networking resource for the hospitality industry, providing scholarships, education, leadership development, recognition of excellence, and business development opportunities. It’s about Scholarship, Education, and Business Networking. The President shall be Chief Executive Officer and, subject to the Executive Committee, shall have general supervision and control over its affairs. The President shall: Supervise and direct the business of the chapter, keeping all board members focused on setting and meeting the goals of NEWH, Inc Encourage future leaders Encourage teamwork and ensure involvement of all members in the chapter

Mary was a great co-worker. She showed me several "tricks of the trade" that I was able to use on my transition into calling on a new segment of our industry.She is a consummate professional, who is always focused on the needs of the client, all the while letting her true personality shine through. Her ability to form long lasting, genuine relationships is a talent that the truly best salespeople all possess.I wish Mary was still in Chicago and I could have recommended her to work for Allsteel today!

In the hospitality business, you learn as a service provider to never say NO to a client.  I've learned that from the many industry leaders I've been associated.  Regarding Mary Blanchard  - the title Sales Representative may be a misnomer:  She actually is an Ambassador for Carnegie. Mary has never once said no to me, yet she has always provided alternatives for every obstacle our projects have presented. I enjoy working with her and that's why I repeatedly make her my initial call whenever a project is undertaken. She has the best business manner and unending knowledge of her products and manufacturing techniques. I recommend her wholeheartedly as an effective and creative team member for business.

Mary is a fantastic sales rep. She's always very personable and is consistently reliable. I've used her products several times and even used her as a substitution at the last minute for some fabric/acoustical wall panels. We needed a custom color on a specific fabric that had sound transparency and Mary was fantastic and getting the samples done quickly when I was in such a pinch. The project turned out absolutely perfect! She's a perfect example of the qualities desired in a great manufacturer's rep.

Jaime Clem worked with me as my customer service representative during her time with BuzziSpace. I appreciated her quick and knowledgeable responses to my questions and requests. In addition, Jaime was an integral part of my success in securing, and executing, one of the first large scale commercial US projects for BuzziSpace. This project was multi-phased with multiple product categories which required multiple vendors. Jaime had her eye on each order throughout the entire process and kept our vendors up to date on crucial information that helped keep the project on track and on time. Jaime is a hard working individual with an easy going, honest demeanor. She would be a successful addition to any sales team.

Mike Wong is a highly educated and personable IT professional.  While continuing to stay on top of new technologies and network systems, Mike conveys a professionalism and willingness to assist in even the most basic computer trouble shooting tasks.  His knowledge of the furniture and design industry made his 3D visualization and marketing presentations very compelling to the customers we were trying to reach and no doubt lead to new customers doing business with us.  I would recommend Mike Wong for any organization looking for a competent IT professional to be a partner in their business development goals.

summary: I am an independent sales consultant for the following contract furniture and finishes manufacturers:Andreu World America - Arizona, New Mexico, Las Vegas, NevadaBOLON by VIIIR - Arizona, New MexicoCamira - Arizona, Las Vegas, NevadaChelsom Ltd - Arizona, New Mexico, Las Vegas, Nevada, El Paso, TexasIntegra Seating - ArizonaInterna - Arizona, New Mexico, Las Vegas, Nevada, El Paso, TexasModern Nature Designs - ArizonaSkyline Design - Arizona, New Mexico, Las Vegas, Nevada, El Paso, TexasSoelberg Industries/Textures - Arizona, New Mexico, Las Vegas, Nevada, El Paso, TexasPlease visit my website to learn more about the manufacturers listed above. www.thematerialcollective.comSpecialties: Developing new business opportunities in both established and underserved markets; Developing solid relationships within the design industry; Providing superior customer service; Excellent presentation skills.
